The reaction equation (L34) shows a 1:1 mole ratio between CaCO3 and CO2, so n(CO2) = 0.041958... mol. Finally, calculate the mass of CO2 using Mr(CO2) = 44.0: m(CO2) = 0.041958... mol * 44.0 g mol-1 = 1.8461... g. Rounded to 3 significant figures, the mass is 1.85 g.
